TopicTitle: What was your first mun landing with?

Articles.Content:
What was your first mun landing with? Mine was with the IFE Intrepid SLS, now discontinued

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/3396-Industrial-Flames-Explosions-Inc-Version-1-4-2-Now-Available!

Post your landing vehicles, if you have pictures, or if you don't, just detail how the mission went.

Edited July 10, 2013 by Mr. Pseudonym
And also, the picture that now stands glorious (and rendered) in this topic: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/25231-kerbin-art

My first landing was with the creatively named Ã¢â‚¬Âmun LanderÃ¢â‚¬Â back in .16

Edited July 10, 2013 by duncan1297
Some random lander like the one pictured above that existed in an earlier save what got deleted.
Think I might still have the craft. But, anyways. Tis was a craft that more then likely had way to much fuel for what was needed and was only a single Kerbal craft too.
This screenshot was taken on Minmus (obviously) but it's the same lander I used for my first Mun landing.
My first lander that made it comprised of: original Mk1 capsule, 2x 400L tanks, LV-T45, and because landing struts weren't available back then, we improvised with radial decouplers and fins.
It looked like this:
My first (successful) mun landing was in .16.
My first MÃƒÂ¼n lander had to use winglets mounted on radial decouplers! None of that landing leg nonsense back then!

The IFE parts pack! How I miss that hmm anyway...

First successful landing and return made back in 0.12. I got KSP Silisko Edition, NovaPunch and KW Challenger parts thrown in.

even had more mods thrown in. Lets just say I'm the guy who will refuse to play the game without mods before...
Mine was launched on a Sunday Punch-based rocket, with some other add-on leg parts. It was mostly a success.

My first successful Mun landing was in the 0.18 (I think) demo back in late April / early May using this..

I had actually landed another craft on Mun prior to this one which I guess was successful from a Kerbal perspective as it was "mostly intact" by the time it stopped rolling . The one above did properly land though and was supposed to be the rescue ship but sadly didn't have enough fuel (or I didn't have the skill / knowledge) to make the return trip, we won't mention that I also landed it too far away from the Kerbal that needed rescuing anyway .
My second Mun Landing but it's the same lander, I used my Murs-I Rocket with this lander in 0.12 x5 I think.
Back in my day, we didn't have those silly ole 'landing legs.' No, we had to use WINGLETS attached to radial decouplers to land on the Mun. You kids today have everything...

The "Falcon" (now MK I).

Didn't have lights, solar panels, batteries aaaaaand! No MechJeb.

This Lander

I still use this lander for some missions too even though it lacks rcs.

P.S. I don't know how you guys have three man capsules for your first mun landings, I actually mastered rendezvous and docking before I was able to make a craft capable of getting a three man capsule to the mun and back.

Edited July 10, 2013 by wolfedg

Back in my day, we didn't have those silly ole 'landing legs.' No, we had to use WINGLETS attached to radial decouplers to land on the Mun. You kids today have everything...

We had mods with Landing Legs

We had mods with Landing Legs

Rigid landing legs. Finding out how to stuff them inside a fairing was already a pain in the butt

Mine was with the Kerpollo Lunar Module mod in version 13.3.

I still haz pict-shores.

This was taken on February 8th, 2012.

Of course, this was before I cared enough to take the realistic measures of landing the LM so that the ladder/windows were in shadow at 10 degrees, but now, I never miss a realistic, low periapsis landing. This was, afterall, my first landing.
Mine was with a LK from the bobcat Soviet pack.Didn't take pics.
My first Mun landing was following the Apollo 11 tutorial on the wiki.

Cool stories!

If anyone hasn't flown the IFE SLS, I can forgive you, but you really missed out. Really cool parts. The SRBs got put into the Component Space Shuttle mod, which is/was relatively popular.

The first time I landed on the Mun, I ascended and returned, came back down, and deployed my parachute too late, causing it to rip off and kill Bill, Bob, and Jeb. The second time, I didn't make the same mistake, and saved the Kerbals on board. I then over-engineered a rocket capable of landing on Minmus and the Mun. Didn't really do anything else there, except the giant station I set up in Mun orbit. Don't have pictures except for the launch of one of the parts

My first landing was done as part of the Mun Race campaign on the Wiki:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Campaign:_Mun_Race

No mods either. No ASAS either.

Kerbollo 11, JitterBug landed at JitterBase

I left a few science experiments, just like the real thing

Edited July 10, 2013 by inigma

The smeagle has landed.... I think that was in .12 note use of fins, radial decouplers, RCS pods and struts.. lots of struts as landing gear... and no mechjeb

Boris

<<thinking that newbies to ksp should be made to land on the mun with that lot before they are allowed landing gear
